segments.key_quote: She is thinking about herself and even about dharma and all the devatas, the rishis, the pitris, the Vaishnavas, the devotees about all the people, she is thinking.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam where Mother Earth, in the form of a cow, expresses her concern for the well-being of all beings.
segments.transcript: In this session, we are discussing from the 31st verse of the 16th chapter of the 1st canto of Shri Madbhagavatam: Atmanam Chanu Shochami Bhavantam Chamarottamam Devan Pitrin Rishin Sadhun Sarvan Varanam Stathashraman. The meaning of this 31st verse is as follows: I am thinking about myself and also, O best amongst the demigods, about you as well as about all the demigods, sages, denizens of Pitraloka, devotees of the Lord, and all men obedient to the system of Varana and Ashrama in human society. These are words spoken by Dharini, Mother Earth, in the shape of a cow to Dharma, the personality of religious principles, in the shape of a bull. So, what is Dharini telling? She is thinking about herself and even about dharma and all the devatas, the rishis, the pitris, the Vaishnavas, the devotees, about all the people, she is thinking.

segments.key_quote: to effect the perfection of human life there is cooperation between men and demigods sages, denizens of Pitraloka, devotees of the Lord
segments.summary: The speaker discusses Srila Prabhupada's purport on the verse, emphasizing the importance of cooperation between different personalities and the scientific system of Varna and Ashrama for achieving perfection in human life.
segments.transcript: What about their condition, their position? So, in the purport, Srila Prabhupada says something like this. So, in the purport, Srila Prabhupada says something about the cooperation that is required between different personalities forever, even our basic existence. Srila Prabhupada says in the purport, "To effect the perfection of human life, there is cooperation between men and demigods, sages, denizens of Pitraloka, devotees of the Lord and sages, denizens of Pitraloka, devotees of the Lord and the sages and presentee are like a fire and a tool." So, when you are in magor and puja and you can become one with each other, much√≠simas gracias, the scientific system of Varna and ashrama of life. What is Varna ashrama? Varna means the social divisions according to the occupation. So the brahmanas work in one way, they are intellectuals, then the sages, the denizens of Pitraloka, all of them, they have to cooperate for perfection of human life because they are all different controllers and have different types of control exercised over the human beings on the earth. So Srila Prabhupada says in the purport further, "The distinction between human life and animal life therefore begins with the scientific system of Varna and Ashrama guided by the experience of the sages in relation with the demigods gradually rising to the summit of reestablishment our eternal relation with the supreme absolute truth, the personality of Godhead."

segments.key_quote: but there is a fifth activity and that's called dharma and without dharma a human being is on the level of animals
segments.summary: The speaker differentiates between human and animal life, highlighting dharma as the key distinguishing factor.
segments.transcript: So the scriptures describe this that there are four activities which are common for human beings and animals: the demands of the body, ahara nidra bhaya maithunam, the demands of the body, the necessity of food, necessity of sleep or rest in the afternoon and at night also, and the necessity of the body in terms of defense, protecting oneself, and mating, the necessity of sex life for procreation. So these four are common activities between animals and human beings, but there is a fifth activity and that's called dharma, and without dharma a human being is on the level of animals, living a life on the level of animals: dharma viheen apadabha, dharma viheen apadabha, dharma viheen apadabha.

segments.key_quote: God made Varna ashrama dharma which is strictly meant for developing animal consciousness into human consciousness and human consciousness into godly consciousness levels of advancement for human beings
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the purpose of Varna and Ashrama Dharma, explaining how it facilitates the transformation from animal consciousness to human consciousness and ultimately to godly consciousness.
segments.transcript: This is the statement of the Shastra. So therefore, human life means there has to be the scientific system of Varna and ashrama guided by the experience of the sages in relation with the devatas gradually rising to the perfection of human life when one is able to re-establish one's Lord's lost connection with Krishna. So when God made Varna ashrama Dharma, Krishna says in the Bhagavad Gita, chaturvaranyam maya-srishtam guna-karma-vibhagasaham. So this God made Varna ashrama dharma which is strictly meant for developing animal consciousness into human consciousness. You can see that in the Bhagavad Gita there is a verse in the Bhagavad Gita that says, So this God made Varna ashrama Dharma which is strictly meant for developing animal consciousness into human consciousness and human consciousness into godly consciousness levels of advancement for human beings from animal consciousness to human consciousness by following the Varna ashrama Dharma and from human conscious to godly consciousness by following the teachings of the Bhagavad Gita by following the teachings of the bhagavatam like that and in this way when one makes actual factual spiritual advancement then one can very easily understand who am I who is God what is my relationship etc so this arrangement of the Bhagavad Gita which is strictly meant for developing animal consciousness into human consciousness by following the teachings of the Bhagavad Gita by following the teachings of the bhagavatam like that.

segments.key_quote: in Kali Yuga the first attack of the venomous snake strikes against God made varnashrama this God made varnashrama is almost destroyed by the influence of the Kali Yuga
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the challenges posed by Kali Yuga to the proper understanding and implementation of Varna and Ashrama Dharma, highlighting the distortion of the system and the misinterpretation of scriptures.
segments.transcript: The ultimate of the supreme Lord for a human society of Varna ashrama Dharma is broken by advancement of foolishness. That means people don't properly understand the purpose of this varnashrama, they criticize, they give trouble, they challenge the authority, etc. So such disturbance in the human society in the name of following some varnashrama but actually not in proper spirit, the system of progressive life becomes at once disturbed. So Prabhupada says in Kali Yuga the first attack of the venomous snake strikes against God made varnashrama. This God made varnashrama is almost destroyed by the influence of the Kali Yuga and a person properly qualified as a Brahmana is treated like a shudra in Kali Yuga and a shudra by qualification such a person is passing off as a Brahmana and what is the basis? Oh, I was born in a Brahmana family or somebody else is not born in a Brahmana family. So these are all not the proper understanding of the Shastra. So proper understanding of the Shastra means by birth there is no consideration of somebody being belonging to Brahmana Kshatriya Vaishal Shudra Varanasa.

segments.key_quote: simply a person develops control of the mind control of the senses and cultivates tolerance simplicity cleanliness knowledge truthfulness devotion and faith in the Supreme then one becomes a really qualified Brahmana
segments.summary: The speaker describes the qualities of a true Brahmana and laments the corrupting influence of Kali Yuga, which leads to a decline in these qualities and a lack of interest in transcendence.
segments.transcript: So this has to be understood carefully that birth is not the criterion, though Srila Prabhupada says that if somebody is born in a good Brahmana family they have very good opportunity to get trained up as a Brahmana right from the early stages of your life, but they are not the criteria for their birth. So this has to be understood carefully that birth is not the criterion, though Shri their life but even if we don't consider this consideration of birth or consideration of occupational duties, we don't consider that, but simply a person develops control of the mind, control of the senses, and cultivates tolerance, simplicity, cleanliness, knowledge, truthfulness, devotion, and faith in the Supreme, then one becomes a really qualified Brahmana. And in the present age, the influence of Kali is such that people neglect the knowledge of the Supreme to follow the proper culture and they become victim of the age of Kali, they become victim of the age of Kali. So due to this age of Kali, the influence of the age, everything is topsy-turvy, especially as regards varnashrama, it's topsy-turvy. We don't have qualified Brahmanas, we don't have qualified Kshatriyas, we don't have very much qualified Vaishyas, some Vaishyas are there but not very qualified, and the influence of the Kali also makes people corrupt, they are not straightforward, they are not
